meanings.sent1: She enjoys ministering to the elderly in her community.
meanings.sent2: The nurse is ministering to the patient's wounds.
meanings.sent3: The superhero spent the day ministering to those in need.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's words were like ministering balm to the student's troubled heart.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter was ministering to the injured with skill and care.

meanings.definition: To attend to the needs of others
meanings.sent1: He is always ministering to his friends when they are feeling down.
meanings.sent2: The volunteers are ministering to the homeless population.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be ministering to its own needs, demanding attention.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like ministering hands, soothing his worries.
meanings.sent5: The kind neighbor was ministering to the family by bringing them meals.

meanings.definition: The act of providing assistance or care
meanings.sent1: Her ministering to the sick was greatly appreciated by all.
meanings.sent2: The ministering of the charity organization reached many in need.
meanings.sent3: The dog's ministering to its puppies was heartwarming to watch.
meanings.sent4: The ministering of the volunteers brought hope to the devastated community.
meanings.sent5: The ministering of the teacher extended beyond the classroom, helping students in various ways.
